Vurteau Broadcast Studio has detected d: Vurteau Broadcast Studio has detected dropped frames
Some frames have not been uploaded. Thi: Some frames have not been uploaded. This problem is usually related to a poor network connection.
Check the health of your Internet connec: Check the health of your Internet connection
If none of these worked, lower your bitr: If none of these worked, lower your bitrate
Vurteau Broadcast Studio has detected sk: Vurteau Broadcast Studio has detected skipped frames
Some frames have not been encoded.
This problem is usually due to high CPU: This problem is usually due to high CPU usage or unsuitable encoder settings.
Ensure that you don't have any other app: Ensure that you don't have any other applications open that are heavy on your CPU
Enable performance mode in the Editor co: Enable performance mode in the Editor context menu
Vurteau Broadcast Studio has detected la: Vurteau Broadcast Studio has detected lagged frames
Some frames took too long to get rendere: Some frames took too long to get rendered.
Usually the problem is related to your g: Usually the problem is related to your game using up too many GPU resources.
When this happens, Vurteau Broadcast Stu: When this happens, Vurteau Broadcast Studio does not have any resources left over to render frames.
Disable FreeSync or GSync in your Driver: Disable FreeSync or GSync in your Driver
Lower graphics settings until you stop l: Lower graphics settings until you stop lagging frames
Disable hardware decoding under any Medi: Disable hardware decoding under any Media Sources(This will slightly increase cpu over gpu)
